engine.components

Class AudioComponent

  • java.lang.Object
    • engine.core.entity.EntityComponent
      • engine.components.AudioComponent

  • public class AudioComponent
extends EntityComponent
    Holds sounds that can be played by an entity.
    Author:
    Benny Bobaganoosh (thebennybox@gmail.com)

    • Constructor Detail

      • AudioComponent

        public AudioComponent(Entity entity,
              java.lang.String[] soundNames,
              Sound[] soundsIn)
        Creates a new AudioComponent
        Parameters:
        entity - The entity this component is attached to.
        soundNames - Strings identifying the sounds being passed in.
        soundsIn - The sounds being added to the component.

    • Method Detail

      • getDefaultVolume

        public double getDefaultVolume(java.lang.String soundName)
        Gets the volume that the sound was originally created with.
        Parameters:
        soundName - The sound of interest.
        Returns:
        default volume if sound exists, -1.0 otherwise.

      • setVolume

        public void setVolume(java.lang.String soundName,
             double volume)
        Sets the volume of a sound to a particular value.
        Parameters:
        soundName - The sound of interest.
        volume - How loud the audio should be played at. 1.0 specifies normal volume, and lower or higher values specify quieter or louder volumes, respectively.

      • play

        public void play(java.lang.String soundName)
        Plays a sound. If it is already playing, it is stopped and restarted. When the audio is finished playing, it will stop if the object's shouldLoop is false, or it will restart if the object's shouldLoop is true.
        Parameters:
        soundName - The sound to be played.

      • pause

        public void pause(java.lang.String soundName)
        Stops playing this sound, but leaves its position alone. When the object is played again, it should start where it left off.
        Parameters:
        soundName - The sound to be paused.

      • stop

        public void stop(java.lang.String soundName)
        Stops playing this sound and resets its position to the start of the audio. When the object is played again, it should start at the beginning.
        Parameters:
        soundName - The sound to be stopped.
